subject: Programming
title: Directed Acyclic Graphs
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Directed Acyclic Graphs.

hook.text: A DAG flows in one direction with no loops. Tasks that depend on other tasks form a DAG.

buildup.text: Build systems, spreadsheet formulas, and course prerequisites are all directed acyclic graphs.

discovery.text: Topological sort orders a DAG so every task comes after its dependencies. Schedules emerge naturally.

twist.text: If you find a cycle, there's no valid order. Circular dependencies make the problem impossible.

climax.text: DAGs model anything with dependencies and ordering. Git commit history is a DAG you use daily.

punchline.text: No loops, clear dependencies, natural order.

quiz.question: What is a directed acyclic graph used for?
options: Modeling tasks with dependencies and ordering
